fields.name: Polarized Thinking
fields.blurb: You look at things in absolute, black-and-white categories.

fields.name: Overgeneralization
fields.blurb: You view a negative event as a never-ending pattern of defeat.

fields.name: Mental Filtering
fields.blurb: You dwell on the negatives and ignore the positives.

fields.name: Discounting the Positives
fields.blurb: You insist that your accomplishments or positive qualities don’t count.

fields.name: Mind Reading
fields.blurb: You assume that people are reacting negatively to you (jumping to conclusions).

fields.name: Fortune-Telling
fields.blurb: You predict that things will turn out badly (jumping to conclusions).

fields.name: Magnification/Minimization
fields.blurb: You blow things way out of proportion (catastrophizing) or you shrink their importance.

fields.name: Emotional Reasoning
fields.blurb: You reason from how you feel: "I feel like an idiot, so I must be one."

fields.name: "Should" Statements
fields.blurb: You criticize yourself or other people with "shoulds," "shouldn’ts," "musts," "oughts," and "have-tos."

fields.name: Labeling
fields.blurb: Instead of saying, "I made a mistake," you tell yourself, "I’m a jerk" or "a loser."

fields.name: Blame/Personalization
fields.blurb: You blame yourself for something you weren’t entirely responsible for (personalization), or you blame other people and overlook ways that you contributed to a problem.

fields.name: Control Fallacies
fields.blurb: You feel in control of (or responsible for) everything in your life (or the lives of others), or you feel you have no control at all.

fields.name: Fallacy of Fairness
fields.blurb: You believe you know what’s fair and what isn’t, and it upsets you when others disagree with you.

fields.name: Fallacy of Change
fields.blurb: You expect others to change their ways to suit your expectations or needs, particularly when you pressure them enough.

fields.name: Always Being Right
fields.blurb: You see your own opinions as facts of life, trumping everything else, including evidence and the feelings of others.
